name: Sprouts: A Drawing Game
description:
Sprouts is a famous puzzle game created by J. Conway and M. Paterson in 1967. The game starts with several initial spots and the players alternate in connecting the spots by curves and adding a new spot on each newly drawn curve. No curve can cross or touch another curve and each spot can be joined to at most three curves. The first player who cannot make a move loses the game.

Sprouts: A Drawing Game is the first solid Sprouts application with AI player after more than 50 years of the existence of the game. You can play againts a human or a computer opponent on prepared or on custom maps. The game includes a campaign mode containing 150 maps in which you can face four levels of AI, with the hardest one of them playing perfectly. In addition, it is possible to play remotely via the server with other players.
